moves.1. b3 d5 2. Bb2 Bg4:
This is brand new for me -- I've never even prepared for it in my opening database.
I know that I need to play Nf3. I'm guessing that he's ready to capture on f3, and I can't imagine taking back gxf3.
But having pawns on f3 and f2 isn't a completely bad arrangement. They protect e3 and e4 from invasion, and it makes me want to play d4 to control e5, too.
moves.3. Nf3:
Sometimes I think that the most valuable thing about extremely uncommon moves like Bg4 is it creates doubt in my mind about my opening. I'm thinking it's because I don't play and read chess so frequently that I have more natural confidence in what I'm doing.
But isn't that an ongoing trade-off? The beginners I teach are always extremely confident -- so confident that they move way too fast and tend to fall off the virtual cliff because of the simple things they overlook.
moves.3... Nd7 4. e3 e5 5. h3 Bf5: I expected him to take the knight. What am I missing here?
moves.6. Nxe5 Nxe5 7. Bxe5 Qe7 8. Bb2: Now I'm a pawn up, so it's time to complete my development.
moves.8... O-O-O 9. Be2 Kb8 10. O-O Qg5 11. Bg: Normally, you wouldn't offer this trade to weaken your pawns. But I'm already ahead by a pawn. I want to make trades. And the doubled pawns don't come close to compensating him for my extra pawn.
moves.11... Bxg4 12. Qxg4 Qxg4 13. hxg4 Ne7 14: I'll be getting my knight out soon. I haven't decided whether to put him on a3 (then where would he go) or d2 heading to f3. I'm not ready to block my bishop yet. In the meantime, I know that I'll need to make this move, so I'll go ahead and do it and see what his plans are.
moves.14... h5 15. gxh5 Rxh5 16. Nc3 Nc6 17. N: I sure didn't see that move coming -- I don't see what his plan is, yet. But one of the open principles is that the best way to refute a sacrifice is to accept it. (Sometimes)
moves.20... Kc8: So I think his last move was just a mistake. I don't see any fantastic follow-up for him. Now, I just need to trade off some more pieces and win in the ending. I look at this position and can confidently say that no one's going to checkmate in the middle game -- the winner will be the person that gets another queen. That's what I'm working towards.
